definition: to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: Here we had, not long ago, a very sad funeral in this church.
sentences.chinese: 不久以前，這教會舉行了一次悲哀的喪禮。

sentences.english: So Mrs. Li trusted the undertakers to take care of the funeral.
sentences.chinese: 所以李太太相信殯葬者，讓他們處理喪禮。

sentences.english: The rest was for the ceremony and undertakers' fees.
sentences.chinese: 其餘的就是喪禮和殯葬者的費用。

sentences.english: The Confucian doctrine of the funeral of filial piety see very heavy, when at the funeral to do all kinds of etiquette.
sentences.chinese: 儒家的孝道把送葬看得很重，在喪禮時要盡各種禮儀。

sentences.english: In ancient China, monarchical power transfer was directly related to the late monarch's obsequies.
sentences.chinese: 中國古代的君權交替過程與故君的喪禮有直接關係。

sentences.english: In ancient China, etiquette for funerals was set by the emperor.
sentences.chinese: 喪禮在中國古時候是由皇帝制定的。

sentences.english: There are only a few at the funeral home and at the graveside .
sentences.chinese: 不論是喪禮，或是落土儀式，都沒有多少觀禮的人。

sentences.english: Some 100,000 Americans stood outside the church at the time of his funeral.
sentences.chinese: 在爲他舉行喪禮時，約10萬人在教堂外肅立致哀。

sentences.english: When Belshazzar mocked God, his feast became a funeral.
sentences.chinese: 當伯沙撒嘲笑神時，他的歡宴變成了喪禮。

sentences.english: She sobbed at her husband's funeral.
sentences.chinese: 她在亡夫喪禮中十分感傷。

sentences.english: Friends had not known where to reach him, so the funeral was then in progress.
sentences.chinese: 友人不知如何通知他，只好着手準備喪禮。

sentences.english: President Obama will be delivered the funeral oration.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬總統將在喪禮上發表祭文。

sentences.english: Joe Jackson says the family is not ready to release details of the singer's funeral plans.
sentences.chinese: 喬傑克遜說，家族尚未準備好公佈麥克爾的喪禮細節。

definition: to offer flowers/to lay flowers (as a memorial)
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
